Title: The Unwavering Striker: Ahmed Al-Sulami's Journey with Damac FC

In the scorching deserts of Saudi Arabia, where football is a revered passion, Ahmed Al-Sulami's name echoes through the stadiums, synonymous with skill, dedication, and an unwavering commitment to his craft. As a professional association football player, Al-Sulami has etched his mark on the Saudi football landscape, and his current affiliation with Damac FC is a testament to his enduring prowess. The story begins in the bustling city of Abha, where Al-Sulami's love affair with football first blossomed. Growing up, he would spend hours honing his skills on the dusty streets, dreaming of the day he would don the colors of his beloved Damac FC. The club, founded in 1972, has a rich history in Saudi football, with a loyal fan base that has witnessed its fair share of triumphs and tribulations. As Al-Sulami's talent began to flourish, he caught the attention of Damac FC's scouts, who were impressed by his lightning-quick reflexes, precision passing, and uncanny ability to find the back of the net. In 2019, the club made the shrewd decision to sign the promising young striker, recognizing the potential for him to become a cornerstone of their attack. Since joining Damac FC, Al-Sulami has been an integral part of the team's success, featuring prominently in their Saudi Pro League campaigns. His impressive goal-scoring record, coupled with his tireless work rate, has earned him the admiration of fans and coaches alike. In the 2020-21 season, he played a crucial role in Damac FC's push for a top-five finish, netting crucial goals against rival teams Al-Hilal and Al-Nassr. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Al-Sulami's association with Damac FC is his consistent presence in the team's matchday squads. According to official Saudi Pro League records, Al-Sulami has made over 50 appearances for Damac FC, scoring 15 goals and providing 7 assists in the process. These statistics not only underscore his importance to the team but also demonstrate his ability to perform under pressure. Furthermore, Al-Sulami's social media profiles, which boast a significant following, frequently feature him donning Damac FC's iconic green and white jersey.
content.source_2:
**HEADLINE:** Ahmed Al-Sulami Bids Farewell to Angeviolet Hiroshima After Nine-Year Stint

**HIROSHIMA, JAPAN - JULY 15, 2038**

In a move that has sent shockwaves through the Japanese football community, Ahmed Al-Sulami, the star midfielder of Angeviolet Hiroshima, has announced his departure from the club after a remarkable nine-year tenure. Al-Sulami, who joined Angeviolet Hiroshima in 2029, has been an integral part of the team's success, helping the club win two J1 League titles, three Emperor's Cups, and a historic AFC Champions League title in 2035. "I'm grateful for the incredible journey I've had with Angeviolet Hiroshima," Al-Sulami said in an emotional press conference at the club's Hiroshima Stadium. "The fans, the staff, and my teammates have become like a second family to me. It's been an honor to wear the Angeviolet jersey and contribute to the club's success." During his time with Angeviolet Hiroshima, Al-Sulami has made 254 appearances, scoring 43 goals and providing 67 assists. His impressive performances have earned him numerous individual accolades, including three J1 League Best XI selections and the 2035 AFC Champions League MVP award. "Ahmed has been an absolute legend for our club," Angeviolet Hiroshima's manager, Tetsuya Nishimoto, said. "His dedication, work ethic, and passion for the game have inspired his teammates and fans alike. We'll miss him dearly, but we're also excited to see what the future holds for him." Al-Sulami's departure has sparked speculation about his next move, with several top European clubs reportedly interested in securing his services. When asked about his future plans, the 33-year-old midfielder remained tight-lipped, saying only that he was "exploring his options" and would make an announcement in due course. As Angeviolet Hiroshima begins a new chapter without their beloved star, fans are left to cherish the memories of Al-Sulami's incredible contributions to the club's success. His legacy will undoubtedly continue to inspire future generations of Angeviolet players.
